name: Kom Ombo Temple and Crocodile Museum
description: {'Information': ['Kom Ombo Temple is a unique ancient Egyptian temple located in Kom Ombo, Aswan. name: Abu Simbel Temple
description: {'Information': ["Abu Simbel Temple is a massive ancient Egyptian temple located in southern Egypt, near Aswan, dating back to the reign of Pharaoh Ramses II. The temple consists of two main structures: one dedicated to Ramses II and the other to his wife Nefertari. The temple is famous for its large facade, featuring four colossal statues of Ramses II. It was relocated to its current site in the 1960s due to the construction of the Aswan High Dam. It is one of Egypt's most famous landmarks, showcasing the brilliance of ancient Egyptian architecture."], 'Main activities': ['Exploring the temple and the colossal statues of Pharaoh Ramses II.', 'Taking souvenir photos of the artworks and carvings on the temple walls.', 'Learning about the temple’s history and the legend of Ramses II through guided tours.', 'Visiting the temple dedicated to Nefertari, Ramses II’s wife.', 'Enjoying the sound and light show held in the evening, which narrates the history of the temple.', 'Enjoying the natural views surrounding the temple, especially the sight of Lake Nasser.'], 'Working hours': ['The Unfinished Obelisk in Aswan is open to visitors daily from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.']}
short_description: Abu Simbel Temple: A huge temple of King Ramesses II, containing giant statues and located near Lake Nasser.

name: ‪Unfinished Obelisk‬
description: {'Information': ["The Unfinished Obelisk in Aswan is one of the city's most prominent archaeological landmarks, located in the quarry of the obelisks. This obelisk represents an unfinished project during the reign of Pharaoh Ramses II, and it is believed that it would have been the largest obelisk in ancient Egypt. It was discovered incomplete, with the carving halted due to cracks in the limestone. The Unfinished Obelisk is an example of ancient Egyptian construction techniques and one of the unique historical sites."], 'Main activities': ['Exploring the unfinished obelisk and observing the ancient carvings.', 'Learning about ancient Egyptian carving and construction techniques through the obelisk.', 'Visiting the surrounding quarry for more insights into the obelisk building process.'], 'Working hours': ['The Unfinished Obelisk in Aswan is open to visitors daily from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.']}

name: Library of Alexandria
description: {'Information': ['The Library of Alexandria is considered one of the greatest libraries of ancient times, established in the 3rd century BCE during the reign of Ptolemy II. It was part of a larger scientific institution known as the "Mouseion," and housed millions of manuscripts and books from various civilizations and cultures.', 'In 2002, the modern Library of Alexandria was inaugurated with international support and funding to revive the spirit of the ancient library. The modern library is located in Alexandria, on the Mediterranean coast, symbolizing knowledge and cultural exchange.'], 'Architectural Design': ['The modern library is designed as a tilted sun disk, reflecting ancient Egyptian civilization. The building consists of 11 floors and features a granite facade engraved with letters and scripts from various languages, representing the diversity of knowledge.'], 'Library Contents': ['Books and Manuscripts: The library houses millions of books in various fields and languages.', 'Museums and Exhibits: It includes specialized museums such as the Manuscript Museum and the Antiquities Museum.', 'Conference Center: Hosts numerous cultural and scientific events.', 'Planetarium: Offers a unique experience for exploring astronomy.', 'Specialized Labs: Includes labs for restoring ancient books and scientific research.']}
short_description: A global center for culture and knowledge, combining ancient heritage and modernity, and is considered one of the most important landmarks of Alexandria.

name: Khan Al-Khalili
description: {'Information': ['Khan El Khalili is one of the oldest and most famous markets in Cairo, located in the heart of the old city near the Al-Hussein district. The market was established in the 14th century during the era of the Mamluk prince Garkas Al-Khalili, after whom it was named. It is a vibrant cultural and commercial hub that reflects the rich history of Islamic Cairo.', 'Khan El Khalili is characterized by its narrow, stone-paved streets and Islamic-style buildings adorned with mashrabiyas and arches. Shops line both sides of the alleys, showcasing goods in a traditional manner that adds a historical charm to the place.', 'It is considered a historical market dating back centuries, originally used as a political gathering place during the Mamluk era. Today, it is the largest market in the Middle East, housing over 4,000 shops.'], 'Activities in Khan El Khalili': ['Shopping in traditional stores.', 'Enjoying food in popular restaurants and famous cafes like "El Fishawy Café," one of the oldest in Cairo.', 'Experiencing the cultural and artistic atmosphere, where musical and artistic events are sometimes held.']}
short_description: Khan Al-Khalili: A vibrant historical market in the heart of Cairo, reflecting the Islamic heritage with splendor and elegance.

name: Baron Empain Palace
description: {'information': ['Baron Empan Palace is located in the Heliopolis area of Cairo and is one of the most important historical and archaeological landmarks in Egypt. The palace was built in the early 20th century by the Belgian engineer Baron Édouard Empain, one of the prominent figures who contributed to the establishment of the Heliopolis neighborhood.', 'The palace features a unique design inspired by Indian architecture. The Baron took inspiration from the "Angkor Wat" temple in Cambodia and Hindu temples in India. The palace was designed to ensure that "the sun never sets" as sunlight enters all of its rooms throughout the day.', 'Baron Empan Palace is considered a unique architectural masterpiece and a testament to the history of Heliopolis. Over the years, the palace has been surrounded by many legends and fascinating stories, adding to its special charm. Today, the palace has been restored and turned into a tourist and cultural landmark that showcases architectural brilliance.', 'The palace consists of two main floors and an upper balcony offering visitors a spectacular view of the surrounding area.'], 'Location': ['Baron Empan Palace is located on Al-Oruba Street in the Heliopolis neighborhood, Cairo, near Cairo International Airport.'], 'Palace Contents:': ['Statues and Decorations: The palace contains bronze statues and intricate decorations reflecting a blend of Indian and European styles.', 'Spiral Staircase: The palace boasts a unique spiral staircase leading to the rooftop.', 'Palace Garden: The spacious garden is filled with statues and rare plants.']}
short_description: An architectural masterpiece inspired by Indian architecture, it is considered a historical and tourist symbol in Heliopolis.

name: Prince Muhammad Ali Palace
description: {'information': ['The Prince Mohammed Ali Palace is located in the Manial area of Cairo and is one of the most prominent historical palaces in Egypt. It was built between 1901 and 1929 by the order of Prince Mohammed Ali Tewfik, who had a passion for Islamic arts and architecture.', 'The palace combines various architectural styles, most notably Islamic, with touches of Ottoman, Moroccan, Persian, and European elements. It stands as an artistic masterpiece that merges grandeur with precision in design.', "The Prince Mohammed Ali Palace stands as a testament to an important era in modern Egyptian history, reflecting the artistic and cultural taste of Prince Mohammed Ali. Today, it is one of Cairo's most important tourist attractions, drawing visitors from all over the world."], 'Location': ['Prince Mohamed Ali Palace is located in El-Manial area in Cairo, Egypt. It enjoys a strategic location on Rhoda Island, offering stunning views and proximity to many other tourist attractions in the capital.'], 'Palace Contents:': ['The Saraya: The main building with ornate reception rooms and a collection of artworks and manuscripts.', 'The Palace Mosque: Known for its unique Islamic design and intricate geometric decorations.', 'The Clock Tower: A distinctive tower showcasing Islamic architectural craftsmanship.', "The Museum: Houses the prince's personal belongings, including weapons, carpets, and jewelry.", 'The Gardens: Expansive gardens beautifully landscaped, featuring rare plants and fountains.']}
short_description: A historical architectural masterpiece in Manial that combines Islamic style and international arts, surrounded by charming gardens.

name: Muhammad Ali Mosque
description: {'information': ['The Muhammad Ali Mosque, also known as the Alabaster Mosque, is located within the Citadel of Salah al-Din in Cairo. It was commissioned by Muhammad Ali Pasha, the founder of the Alawiyya dynasty in Egypt, in memory of his son Tusun Pasha, who passed away at a young age. Construction began in 1830 and was completed in 1848.', "The mosque is an architectural masterpiece inspired by the Sultan Ahmed Mosque (Blue Mosque) in Istanbul. It features a large central dome about 52 meters high, surrounded by smaller domes. Its two elegant minarets rise prominently, adding to the mosque's majestic appearance.", 'Inside, the mosque is adorned with alabaster marble walls, giving it the name "Alabaster Mosque." The main prayer hall boasts stunning Islamic decorations and magnificent chandeliers that illuminate the space beautifully.', "The mosque is one of Cairo’s most important tourist attractions, drawing visitors from around the globe to admire its Islamic architecture and explore Egypt's history during Muhammad Ali Pasha's era."], 'Location': ['The mosque is situated within the Citadel of Salah al-Din, a historic site that offers panoramic views of Cairo.']}
short_description: A nineteenth-century Ottoman architectural masterpiece inside the Saladin Citadel, highlighting fine Islamic art.

name: Sea Gull Restaurant
description: {'About Sea Gull Restaurant': ["Sea Gull Restaurant is located on El-Max Beach with a stunning view of the Mediterranean Sea, making it one of Alexandria's top seafood restaurants.", 'The restaurant is known for its beautiful design and tranquil seating areas, offering a unique dining experience perfect for families and friends.', "It also features an outdoor area with children's play facilities and seating for adults."], 'Menu Highlights': ['The restaurant serves a variety of delicious seafood dishes, including:', 'Seafood Fatta', 'Fried Fish Fillet', 'Singari Fish'], 'Location and Accessibility': ['Situated on El-Max Beach, the restaurant combines great food with a scenic seaside view.'], 'Opening Hours': ['Open daily from 12:00 PM to 1:00 AM.']}

name: Délices Restaurant
description: {'About Delices Restaurant': ['Delices Restaurant is one of the oldest and finest restaurants in Alexandria, established in 1922 and still managed by the same family.', 'The restaurant is distinguished by its antique design, maintained by its owners, making it a popular destination for tourists and locals to enjoy meals and great ambiance.'], 'Menu Highlights': ['The restaurant offers a variety of renowned international dishes, such as:', 'Lemon Chicken', 'French Curry Chicken', 'Greek Grilled Chicken', 'Greek-Style Lamb Shank', 'Soutzoukakia', 'Deluxe Filet Mignon'], 'Location and Accessibility': ['Delices Restaurant is located next to Trianon Restaurant in the heart of Alexandria, ensuring easy access for visitors.'], 'Opening Hours': ['Open daily from 8:00 AM to 12:00 midnight.']}
short_description: Delice Restaurant...an ancient atmosphere and distinctive international dishes.

name: Montaza Palace
description: {'About Montaza Palace': ['Montaza Palace is one of the most important landmarks in Alexandria, known for its rich history dating back to the royal era in Egypt.', 'The palace is distinguished by its unique location overlooking the Mediterranean Sea, offering natural beauty and special charm.', 'The palace is surrounded by vast gardens filled with rare trees and plants, making it a perfect destination for leisure and enjoying nature.'], 'Activities and Facilities': ['Visitors can enjoy guided tours inside the palace to explore its unique architectural design and royal artifacts.', 'The palace gardens feature wide open spaces for picnics, with seating areas and playgrounds for children.', 'Walking or jogging in the dedicated paths within the gardens is highly enjoyable.', 'The palace offers stunning views of the sea, making it an ideal spot for photography.'], 'Location and Accessibility': ['Montaza Palace is located in the Montaza district of Alexandria and is easily accessible via public or private transportation.', 'Parking facilities and comfortable amenities are available, accommodating visitors of all ages.'], 'Opening Hours and Entry Fees': ['The palace is open daily from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.', 'Ticket prices vary depending on the category, with special discounts for students and children.'], 'Nearby Areas': ['Close to the palace are several tourist attractions, such as Antoniades Gardens and Montaza Beach.', 'The area surrounding the palace hosts a variety of restaurants and cafes offering delicious seafood.']}
short_description: Montazah Palace...royal beauty and gardens overlooking the sea.

name: Hajouja Restaurant

The staff is well-trained to provide quick and professional service.'], 'Menu': ["Hajouga's menu features a selection of famous Egyptian dishes, including koshari, molokhia, pies, and casseroles, along with grilled dishes and special appetizers."], 'Location and Accessibility': ['Hajouga Restaurant is located in a convenient area, offering easy access, parking spaces, and indoor and outdoor seating suitable for individuals and families.'], 'Branches': ['Downtown: Talaat Harb Street, near Tahrir Square.', 'Nasr City: Abbas Al Akkad Street, next to City Stars Mall.', 'Mohandessin: Arab League Street, opposite the Shooting Club.', 'Maadi: 9th Street, next to Maadi Metro Station.', 'Fifth Settlement: North Teseen Street, inside Mall 5A.'], 'Contact Information': ['Hotline: 890-567-1234', 'Website: www.hagogarestaurant.com']}
